Issues.Title: .NET 10 app crash with Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in System.Windows.Forms.dll
Issues.Body:
### Description

I'm trying to create a object (MainObject) that references another object (ExternalObject) defined in another assembly (ExternalAsm).
Both MainObject and ExternalObject are UserControl.
The issue occurs when ExternalAsm is missing:
Despite MainObject is not created (because of missing ExternalObject), Control.Dispose is called and fails because Control.Properties is null.

### Reproduction Steps

Run the attached project [net10Issue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22095433/net10Issue.zip) using  .NET 10 framework

### Expected behavior

App exits successfully.

### Actual behavior

crash with Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in System.Windows.Forms.dll

### Regression?

Yes, it won't happen in .NET 9 or lower.

### Known Workarounds

Add try / catch in MainObject Dispose - but this is not an option when using third party assemblies.

### Configuration

.NET 10, Windows 10/11, AnyCPU

### Other information

The MainObject cannot be created (which is correct) but somehow an incomplete object is created and processed by GC. GC will call then Dispose on the incomplete initialized object MainObject which can lead to NullReferenceException.
The issue happens when you create more than 1 instances of MainObject but never for a single one.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".NET 10 app crash with Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in System.Windows.Forms.dll" (#13835)

Issues.Title: Fix 13829 Dark Mode: Button ForeColor ignored in Dark Mode when FlatStyle is Flat/Popup and Form.ForeColor Is set
Issues.Body: Fixes #13829 ## Proposed changes - - Remove BackColorSet, ForeColorSet. use DefaultForeColor,DefaultBackColor to decide whether we should use ButtonBase.BackColor or ButtonBase.ForeColor - ## Screenshots ### After ## Test methodology - - manual - ## Reviewing note when reviewing, to filter out meaningless changes , you can skip the first commit, because it's just name refactor. ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13834)

Issues.Body: Fixes #13813 ## Proposed changes Add code to see if BackColor or ForeColor is specified in dark mode, if so then use the specified color, if not then let the renderer decide the color. ## Screenshots ### Before ### After

Issues.Title: Fix 12571 "DisplayMember" property cannot expand
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #12571


## Proposed changes

- When DataSource is null, do not return value immediately but return after the `designBindingPicker` is created.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- The dropdown list of the `DisplayMember` property of the `PropertyGrid` can be expanded when DataSource is null

## Regression? 

- Yes 

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
There no "Open" button for the "DiaplayMember" property and cannot not expand the dropdown list in the PropertyGrid control

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/37f2a1b7-602e-4c0a-b8fe-6421ebe08f23)


### After
The dropdown list of the `DisplayMember` property can be expanded when DataSource is null

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5016f6e7-3f1f-4616-8bd0-b34cd2edfdb9


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually

- .net 10.0.0-beta.25418.105

Issues.Title: .NET 9.0 Error with DialogFileOpen
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0


### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.NET 8.0

### Issue description

I created a vb.net projekt with .NET 9.0 via project wizzard. The Project only contains a FileOpenDialog from object pallete. As soon as the dialoge is used the programm unexpectedly closes with the following text:

The program '[11668] TestNet9.exe' has exited with code 3221226505 (0xc0000409).

I changed the project to .NET 8.0 without any further modifications. Now there is no problem anymore!

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create new Project with vb.net 9.0
2. Add a new FileOpenDialog
3. Compile and run program
4. Open dialog
5. close dialog
6. wait some seconds (+- 30 seconds)
7. program closes with code 3221226505 (0xc0000409).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".NET 9.0 Error with DialogFileOpen" (#13832)

Issues.Title: Scale the Cursor editor according to DPI
Issues.Body: Fixes #9007 ## Proposed changes - Scale the Cursor Editor's Height as needed. - Update the `OnDrawItem` method to draw the cursor using the scaled width instead of hard-coding it. ## Customer Impact - On High DPI environment, cursor editor in propertyGrid can be scaled well ## Regression? - Yes ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before On High DPI environment, cursor editor in propertyGrid is not scaled well ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/233241549-b9a1d277-74cd-4448-95fb-6b011605cd63.png) ### After On High DPI environment, cursor editor in propertyGrid can be scaled normally ## Test methodology - Manually ## Test environment(s) - .net 10.0.0-rc.1.25418.105 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13830)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: Button ForeColor ignored in Dark Mode when FlatStyle is Flat/Popup and Form.ForeColor Is set
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.2.25420.109 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Yes, The issue doesn't reproduce on .NET SDK 9.0.7 build ### More info 1. The issue also occurs when the Form's BackColor is set 2. The issue also occurs when add button to the container and set container's ForeColor/BackColor ### Issue description In Dark Mode, after setting the Form's ForeColor, the ForeColor of buttons with `FlatStyle.Flat` or `FlatStyle.Popup` does not take effect. .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.2.25420.109: .NET SDK 9.0.7: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a WinForms .NET application with Form.ForeColor is set to Red 2. Add a button to the form designer, set button's FlatStyle as Flat or Popup 3. Enable DarkMode by Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark) in Program.cs file 4. Run application, observe the ForeColor of Button [TestProject.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22002602/TestProject.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: Button ForeColor ignored in Dark Mode when FlatStyle is Flat/Popup and Form.ForeColor Is set" (#13829)

Issues.Title: [dnceng-bot] Branch `winforms/release/9.0` can't be merged to Azdo internal branch
Issues.Body:
Branch [release/9.0](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/commits/release/9.0/) in `dotnet/winforms` repo can't be mirrored from GitHub to Azure [internal/release/9.0](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-winforms?version=GBinternal%2Frelease%2F9.0&_a=history) via internal merge. 

There are conflicting commits in the target branch.
The branch is configured to be mirrored via automated merge. 
The situation is rare but normal. The target branch is expected to receive manual commits in the Azure DevOps clone, which could cause conflict.

Conflicts need to be **resolved to unblock the code flow**.

- you can resolve the issue by resolving the conflict in the **target branch only**. 
    - Please make sure that the changes sensitive from security perspective are not published ahead of time to GitHub!
- reverting the extra commits in the Azdo target branch.
- checking the logs of the mirroring process in the [mirroring pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_build?definitionId=1387).
- you can disable the mirroring of the branch in the [configuration file](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-mirroring?path=/dnceng-subscriptions.jsonc).
- you can ask @dotnet/dnceng for help or read the [documentation](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-mirroring?path=/README.md).

Please close this issue once the conflict is resolved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[dnceng-bot] Branch `winforms/release/9.0` can't be merged to Azdo internal branch" (#13817)

Issues.Title: Add judgement "IsHandleCreated" in OwnerDraw
Issues.Body: Fixes #13823 ## Root Cause The `OwnerDraw` property of the Button control incorrectly returns `false` when `BackgroundImage` is set during early initialization. This is due to the `OwnerDraw` logic checking `BackgroundImage == null` before the control's handle is created, which causes a premature fallback to the system renderer. As a result, even though `BackgroundImage` is later assigned, it is ignored during rendering in `FlatStyle.Standard` mode. ## Proposed changes - Add judgement `IsHandleCreated` in property `OwnerDraw` of the Button.cs ## Customer Impact - The BackgroundImage of Button can be displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode ## Regression? - Yes ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode ### After The BackgroundImage of Button displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode ## Test methodology - Manually ## Test environment(s) - .net 10.0.0-rc.1.25418.105 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13824)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add judgement "IsHandleCreated" in OwnerDraw" (#13824)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100.rc.2.25419.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? The issue also can reproduce on .NET SDK 10.0 Prevview7. there has the known issue https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/13720 to track. after the fix of PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13809, the issue has been fixed when the FlatStyle is Flat/Popup, but still reproduce when the FaltStyle is Standard ### Issue description The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode **.NET 10.0 rc.2 & rc.1 results:** **.NET 10.0 preview7 results:** **.NET 9.0 results:** ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a winforms app, a form and a button with a background image. 2. Run the project in DarkMode 3. Observe results
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode" (#13823)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[release/10.0] Source code updates from dotnet/dotnet" (#13815)

Issues.Title: Remove Experimental attribute for dark mode
Issues.Body:
Fixes #13805 

* Removes the ExperimentalAttribute for all Dark Mode (SetColorMode) related APIs.
* Updates the docs for `Application.SetColorMode` to reflect latest developments.
* Removes #Pragma 5001

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13810)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Source code updates from dotnet/dotnet" (#13812)

Issues.Title: Remove 5002 Experimental state for UI Async area
Issues.Body:
This PR removes the experimental status of the UI Async APIs:

* `Form.ShowAsync`
* `Form.ShowDialogAsync`
* `TaskDialog.ShowDialogAsync`

It also amends the docs with additional information about best practices for using ShowAsync in MultiForm / ToolWindow-async scenarios.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13811)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove 5002 Experimental state for UI Async area" (#13811)

Issues.Title: Improve Form.ShowAsync and Form.ShowDialogAsync
Issues.Body:
* Added unit tests for `ShowAsync`
* Improved `ShowAsync` and `ShowDialogAsync` by associating the Form via `WeakReference` with the returned Task's `AsyncState`, so that it's easy to retrieve the Form from a returned Task in `Task.WhenAny` scenarios.
* Added unit test for that particular scenario.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13808)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Improve Form.ShowAsync and Form.ShowDialogAsync" (#13808)

Issues.Title: Draw background image for button in dark mode
Issues.Body: Fixes #13720 ## Proposed changes - Add `DrawBackgroundImage` in the method `PaintImage` of the `ButtonBaseAdapter.cs` ## Customer Impact - Button background image can be displayed in Winform dark mode ## Regression? - Yes ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before The button background images are no longer displayed in dark mode. ### After The button background images can be displayed in dark mode ## Test methodology - Manually ## Test environment(s) - .net 10.0.0-rc.1.25413.101 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13809)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Draw background image for button in dark mode" (#13809)
